title: 109_hr5821
content: The Act may be cited as the "At-Risk Youth Protection Act of 2006" and includes grants to reduce youth and gang violence. The "At-Risk Youth Protection Act of 2006" allows the Secretary of Education to grant funds to State educational agencies for subgrants to alternative schools or programs that implement a community service requirement to reduce youth and gang violence. State educational agencies must apply for the grant and use it to require secondary school students to participate in community service. The "At-Risk Youth Protection Act of 2006" allows funding for alternative schools or programs to implement community service requirements for secondary school students at risk of education failure. These students must complete 100 hours of community service annually and receive conflict resolution training. Alternative schools or programs must apply for subgrants through the State educational agency. The "At-Risk Youth Protection Act of 2006" allows funding for alternative schools or programs to implement community service requirements for secondary school students at risk of education failure. Community service involves active participation in organized service that meets community needs and fosters civic responsibility. The term "institution of higher education" and "secondary school" are defined in specific education acts. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Education. The term "State educational agency" is also defined. The term "State educational agency" is defined in the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. SEC. 182. COMMUNITY SERVICE DEDUCTION. This section introduces a new deduction for community service in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The deduction for community service in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 allows businesses to deduct $750 per 100 hours of community service completed by a qualified student and $2,000 per qualified employee. There is a limit of $1,500 per qualified student for the deduction. The term 'qualified student' refers to a student enrolled in an alternative school or program who performs community service within 20 miles of the school. A 'qualified employee' is a graduate of such a program who completes 1 year of employment at a business. 'Community service' is defined as per the At-Risk Youth Protection Act. The Secretary will prescribe regulations to ensure that community service completed by a qualified student through a business meets the requirements of the At-Risk Youth Protection Act of 2006. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections. The amendments made by this section regarding the Community service deduction will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2006.
